column16: Leontopodium discolor is a PERENNIAL growing to 0.2 m (0ft 8in).  See above for USDA hardiness. It is hardy to UK zone 6. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Insects.  Suitable for: light (sandy) and medium (loamy) soils and prefers  well-drained soil. Suitable pH: neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils. It cannot grow in the shade. It prefers  moist soil.

column28: Seed - best sown as soon as it is ripe in a cold frame. Only just cover the seed.
